root: ^How wonderful! I knew I could sense someone doing fine work!
^I'll be sure to visit each evening.

About1: ^I've known a few humans in my time. I've liked all of them for different reasons.
About2: ^I love watching you all - there's so much to learn.
About3: ^I miss my home. I feel lighter and brighter when I'm away for a little bit, but in the end I belong among my people.
About4: ^It's important to accomplish what you want to accomplish.
^It's also important to fill your life with things that bring you joy.
^They don't have to be the same thing!
About5: ^One of my favorite things to do is find a place among the branches that everyone tends to pass. Then I can say hello to everyone while resting!
^Plus, I get to catch up on all the gossip and goings on.
Encourage1: ^If you're taking time to talk to me, then I know you're taking care of yourself with a break!
^Putting your mind on something else, even briefly, is like coming up for air out of the water.
^It may not feel like you need it early in on, but you'll run out of air faster by the end if you don't.
Encourage2: ^If everyone just took a deep breath and set about their tasks the way you do, the world would be a better place.
Encourage3: ^The tree is remarkable. No matter how much you prune, it will always grow back stronger.
^Just like you. You will always grow back.
Encourage4: ^When I was a new spirit, several friends and I spent a day with a tree like this one.
^The tree was filled with apples! We shook the tree and all the apples fell out. In the morning, the farmers were amazed and took the apples to bake pies.
^This reminds me so much of that day and those friends. Thank you!
Encourage5: ^You're a remarkable person, to have grown this little home for all these spirits. Thank you!
Tip1: ^Can I let you in on a little pruning secret?
^Everyone has feelings on what makes a tree beautiful.
^But in the end all that matters is that the tree is beautiful to you.
Tip2: ^You have to decide where you want to grow, and what you want to leave behind.
Tip3: ^Pruning isn't about choosing what branches you dislike. It's about choosing the branches you know you love, and letting go of the rest.
Convo1: ^In the spirit world, we don't have parents. We arrive in the spirit realm as full persons, ready to help! However, we often take on a mentor to help guide us through our early years.
^Do you have a mentor? Someone who helps you make decisions about your life path?

c-0: ^Well, that is excellent. They've done a great, I feel.
c-1: ^It can feel awkward to ask, but if you find someone you respect whose life looks like what you want your to look like, you should consider asking.
^A mentor can be a powerful ally against demons and all sorts of spirit world enemies.
^Although, I suppose in the human world they could help you grapple with hard decisions more than slay monsters.

Convo3: ^What would you look back on fondly?
Greeting1: ^Well, a star-filled evening to you, young Tree Keeper.
Greeting2: ^You're always a good sight for old eyes, Tree Keeper.
Greeting4: ^A star-filled night to you, my friend.
Greeting5: ^Excuse me, Tree Keeper? Have a second for an old spirit?
Greeting6: ^By the stars, it's nice that you're here.
Greeting7: ^Be a dear and chat with me, Tree Keeper?
Greeting9: ^I'll say again! It's a delight that you're here!
Greeting10: ^Is that you, Tree Keeper? Of course it is!
Greeting12: ^And a fine evening to you as well, my dear.
Greeting14: ^Ah, yes. It's always good for this old spirit to see you.
Greeting16: ^A star-filled night to you, Tree Keeper.
